Posts.Content: Indomitable1 wrote: OK-so I was on the TAC x 6 regimen but developed a port infection after tx 4. Am on antibiotics after the positive culture and the surgeon removed my port 2 weeks ago. The site was left open, and I'm doing wet to dry dressings (Ouch!) twice daily. Can't get chemo "until infection is gone -at least 2 weeks" per surgeon. Wound specialist chuckled at 2 week estimate. How long can your chemo be interrupted without a problem? It's now been 5 weeks and my hair is starting to grow back (ALL 'white', but that's another issue altogether; planned port placement on the other side is yet another). I feel great. The onc's office called to cancel my labwork and the nurse asked, "You've completed your chemo, right?" HELP. I'll ask again-How long can your chemo be interrupted without a problem? Thanks in advance for your answers and sharing your experiences. ...for we walk by faith, not by sight... Dx 3/16/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/13 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
